Class BitOperator

extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class allows for different bit operations.

    • Method Detail

      • getBit

        public static int getBit(byte b,
                         int index)
                  throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the bit in byte b at the given index. Note that index must be between 0-7
        Parameters:
        b - This is the byte from which a particular bit has to be extracted.
        index - This gives the index of the bit to be extracted.
        Returns:
        Bit 0 or 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is not in the required range.

      • getBits

        public static int[] getBits(byte b)
        Converts the given byte to an integer array.
        Parameters:
        b - This is the byte to be converted.
        Returns:
        Integer array representing the byte

      • getValue

        public static int getValue(byte b,
                           int startBit,
                           int numberOfBits)
                    throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns int equivalent of bit array of specified start location and length
        Parameters:
        b - This is the byte from which values are obtained
        startBit - Start location
        numberOfBits - Length of bits required
        Returns:
        integer equivalent of bit array
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the bits specified are out of range

      • getNibble

        public static int getNibble(byte b,
                            int nibbleIndex)
                     throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns integer equivalent of the nibble in byte b with given nibble index (either 0 or 1)
        Parameters:
        b - byte from which nibble is returned
        nibbleIndex - indicates which nibble is to be returned
        Returns:
        integer equivalent of required nibble
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if nibbleIndex is anything but 0 or 1

      • parse

        public static byte[] parse(byte[] header,
                           int startBit,
                           int endBit)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if startBit and endBit aren't within the range of header.

      • lieBetween

        private static boolean lieBetween(int target,
                                  int lowerLimit,
                                  int upperLimit)
        Checks if the target lies between the lowerLimit and UpperLimit
        Parameters:
        target - This is the value that must lie between the given values
        lowerLimit - target must be above this.
        upperLimit - target must be below this.
        Returns:
        true if target lies between the two numbers, otherwise false
